body_html:
Updated to a better solution where we get rid of Def.hpp entirely.

We needed a generated header file before because compiling c10d and the PyTorch C module were two different calls without a means to pass configuration options between them. As mentioned in the new description, with the updated unified build we can use CMake target properties (of the c10d target) to propagate downstream compile definitions.

body:
Updated to a better solution where we get rid of `Def.hpp` entirely.

We needed a generated header file before because compiling c10d and the PyTorch C module were two different calls without a means to pass configuration options between them. As mentioned in the new description, with the updated unified build we can use CMake target properties (of the c10d target) to propagate downstream compile definitions.
